Title:
Robert Browns Caladenia (Orchidaceae) revisited: results of
molecular phylogenetic analyses of Caladeniinae plastid and nuclear
loci
Abstract:
The classification of the primarily Australasian group of
orchids Caladenia and allied genera (Caladeniinae: Diurideae) has proven
controversial. We present a multigene analyses based on nuclear
ribosomal ITS and five plastid regions from 54 species representing all
major taxonomic groups within Caladeniinae that provides a sound basis
for reinterpretation of Caladenia and allied genera. In our combined
analysis, apart from Leptoceras and Praecoxanthus, all Caladenia ingroup
taxa align in a strongly supported monophyletic group which is also
supported by morphological synapomorphies. Characters and character
states historically used to delimit taxa were revealed to be
homoplasious and therefore do not support recognition of Arachnorchis,
Cyanicula, Drakonorchis, Ericksonella, Jonesiopsis, Petalochilus,
Pheladenia and Stegostyla as previously proposed. Glossodia and
Elythranthera are shown to be a specialist group embedded within
Caladenia. Based on our results, none of the current systems of
classification of the subtribe is satisfactory. Instead our results
point to Lindleys 1840 interpretation of Caladenia, but including
Glossodia and Elythranthera, as being the most accurate reflection of
the group. Accordingly a renewed reclassification of Caladeniinae is
proposed which necessitates the description of Caladenia subgen.
Parapentisia M.A.Clem. to accommodate Caladenia caerulea as well as
several new combinations.
